thread.title: Retired NJ firefighter burned alive while riding lawnmower
thread.title_full: Retired NJ firefighter burned alive while riding lawnmower - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Retired NJ firefighter burned alive while riding lawnmower
text:
WCAU Retired Burlington County New Jersey Firefighter, Roger Lippincot, 79, died on October 11, 2015 when the lawnmower he was operating burst into flames. A retired New Jersey firefighter was burned alive while riding a lawnmower that erupted into flames.
Roger Lippincot, 79, was mowing the lawn at about 2:21 p.m. on Sunday when the lawnmower he was riding suddenly burst on fire in a freak accident, cops said.
Lippincot, a 50-year veteran member of the Springfield Township Fire Company, suffered severe burns across his body and died near the lawnmower on the front yard, state police told the Daily News.
